intro: Sparaxis grandiflora subsp. acutiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spear百合, is a perennial bulbous plant native to South Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tall, erect stems with showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. This subspecies is noted for its hardiness and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
